entry.title: Walter Kirchhoff (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that operatic tenor Walter Kirchhoff (pictured) was also an officer in the cavalry division of the Imperial German Army?

entry.title: a former public bath (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Permanent Mission of Indonesia to the United Nations is housed in a former public bath?

entry.title: Malacchi Esdale (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that rugby sevens player Malacchi Esdale said that the conditioning he went through to play in the Olympics was "borderline crazy"?

entry.title: Fantasy (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Fantasy, performed at the Luxor Las Vegas hotel, is the longest-duration topless production in Las Vegas at a single venue?

entry.title: two kidnapped activists (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that two kidnapped activists were released after claiming at a press conference that they were abducted by government forces?

entry.title: Mary Jane Patterson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Mary Jane Patterson, whose mother was an African-American slave, gained a BA degree in 1862 having taken a "gentleman's course"?

entry.title: One Room Angel (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the angel's wings in the live-action television-drama adaptation of One Room Angel took about a month to construct?

entry.title: Dorothy Stanley (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Dorothy Stanley was once said to be one of the last speakers of the Miwok languages?

entry.title: fan wikis (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that some fan wikis document fan fiction?
